trans-unit.source: Represents a Security Assertion Markup Language 1.1 (SAML 1.1) assertion.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion> class corresponds to the `<saml:Assertion>` XML element that is defined in the OASIS SAML 1.1 specification.
The claims for <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens are contained within a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion>.

A <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion> has an extensible set of claims known as SAML statements that are represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.Statements%2A> property.
The SAML authority that issued the SAML assertion is specified in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.Issuer%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion"></xref> class.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion"></xref> class using the specified SAML assertion identifier, issuer of the assertion, the date and time when the assertion was issued, a set of processing conditions, additional information, and a collection of SAML statements.
The `assertionId` parameter must start with a letter or the "_" character.
The identifier for the assertion.
The SAML authority that issued this SAML assertion.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that specifies when the SAML assertion was issued.
assertionId is `null`
-or-
assertionId is
-or-
assertionId does not start with a letter or the "_" character.
-or-
issuer is `null`
-or-
issuer is
-or-
samlStatements is `null`
-or-
samlStatements does not contain any elements
-or-
samlStatements contains a `null` element

Gets or sets additional information related to the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> that is supplied by the SAML authority that can aide in the processing of the SAML assertion.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.Advice%2A> property corresponds to the `<saml:Advice>` element defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS SAML specification.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAdvice"></xref> that specifies additional information that is supplied by the SAML authority that can aide in the processing of the SAML assertion.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.Advice"></xref> property is set and the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.IsReadOnly"></xref> property is `true`.
Gets or sets the identifier for this assertion.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.AssertionId%2A> property corresponds to the `AssertionID` attribute of the `<saml:Assertion>` element defined in the OASIS SAML 1.1 specification.
The identifier for this assertion.

The value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.IsReadOnly"></xref> property is `true` and an attempt is made to set the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.AssertionId"></xref> property.
An attempt is made to set the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.AssertionId"></xref> property to `null` or an empty string.
Gets a value that indicates whether this assertion was deserialized from XML source and can re-emit the XML data unchanged.

The default implementation preserves the source data when read using the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityTokenHandler.ReadAssertion%2A> method and can re-emit the original data as long as the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml.SamlAssertion.AssertionId%2A> property has not changed from the time that assertion was read.
It is very important that SAML assertions with different data have different IDs.
If implementing a scheme whereby an assertion "template" is loaded and certain bits of data are filled in, the Id must be changed.
`true` if this assertion can re-emit the XML source data unchanged; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a set of conditions that may be taken into account when assessing the validity of the SAML assertion.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.Conditions%2A> property corresponds to the `<saml:Conditions>` element defined in the OASIS SAML 1.1 specification.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions"></xref> that specifies a set of conditions that may be taken into account when assessing the validity of the SAML assertion.

The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.IsReadOnly"></xref> property is `true` and an attempt is made to set the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.Conditions"></xref> property.
Gets a value indicating whether the properties of this instance are read-only.
To make this instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion> class read-only, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.MakeReadOnly%2A> method.
`true` if the properties of this instance are read-only; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets the date and time when the SAML assertion was issued.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.IssueInstant%2A> property corresponds to the `IssueInstant` attribute of the `<saml:Assertion>` element defined in the OASIS 1.1 SAML specification.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> expressed in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) that specifies when the SAML assertion was issued.

The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.IsReadOnly"></xref> property is `true` and an attempt is made to set the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.IssueInstant"></xref> property.
Gets or sets the name of the SAML authority that issued this SAML assertion.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.Issuer%2A> property corresponds to the `Issuer` attribute of the `<saml:Assertion>` element defined in the OASIS SAML 1.1 specification.
The SAML authority that issued this SAML assertion.

The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.IsReadOnly"></xref> property is `true` and an attempt is made to set the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.Issuer"></xref> property.
An attempt is made to set the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.Issuer"></xref> property to `null` or an empty string.
Gets the major version of the SAML specification to which this SAML assertion conforms.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.MajorVersion%2A> property corresponds to the `MajorVersion` attribute of the `<saml:Assertion>` element defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS SAML specification.
The major version of the SAML specification to which this SAML assertion conforms.
The default value is the value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.MajorVersionValue"></xref> property.
Causes this instance to be read-only.
When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.MakeReadOnly%2A> method is called, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.IsReadOnly%2A> property is set to `true`.
Gets the minor version of the SAML specification to which this SAML assertion conforms.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.MinorVersion%2A> property corresponds to the `MinorVersion` attribute of the `<saml:Assertion>` element defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS SAML specification.
The minor version of the SAML specification to which this SAML assertion conforms.
The default value is the value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.MinorVersionValue"></xref> property.
Reads the digital signature for a SAML assertion from an XML reader.
When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.ReadSignature%2A> method is called, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.SigningToken%2A> property is set.
A <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> to read the digital signature.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver"></xref> that determines the security token that created the digital signature.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of reading XML elements that are defined in the SAML specification.
reader is `null`
-or-
samlSerializer is `null`
-or-
the digital signature has not been read from the SAML assertion yet.
Reads a SAML assertion from the specified XML reader.
A <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> to read the SAML assertion.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of reading XML elements in the SAML assertion that are defined in the SAML specification.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver"></xref> that determines the security token that created the digital signature.
reader is `null`
-or-
samlSerializer is `null`

the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.ReadXml(System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader,System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer,System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer,System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver)"></xref> method had been previously called and that SAML assertion was digitally signed.
reader does not refer to a SAML assertion that is compliant with the SAML 1.1 specification.
Gets or sets the security credentials that are used to digitally sign the SAML assertion.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.SigningCredentials%2A> property represents the credentials that are used to sign a SAML assertion when it is serialized into XML.
Similarly, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.SigningToken%2A> property represents the security token that signed a SAML token in an incoming SOAP message.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SigningCredentials"></xref> that is used to digitally sign the SAML assertion.

The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.IsReadOnly"></xref> property is `true` and an attempt is made to set the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.SigningCredentials"></xref> property.
Gets the security token contained in or referenced by a digitally signed SAML assertion.

When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.ReadXml%2A> method is called and a SAML assertion is digitally signed, the digital signature is set to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.SigningCredentials%2A> property.
When the SAML assertion is not digitally signed, the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.SigningCredentials%2A> property is `null`.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken"></xref> contained in or referenced by a digitally signed SAML assertion.
Gets the set of SAML statements associated with the SAML assertion.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.%23ctor%2A> to set the SAML statements associated with a SAML assertion or add it directly to the collection that is returned by this property when the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.IsReadOnly%2A> property is `false`.
The following table maps the three types of SAML statements defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS SAML specification to their respective types.
Statement Type
CLR Type
Authentication
Attribute
Authorization decision
Statement defined in an extension schema
Subject statement defined in an extension schema
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IList`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlStatement"></xref> that contains the SAML statements associated with the SAML assertion.
Writes the source data, if available.

The default implementation preserves the source data when read using the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityTokenHandler.ReadAssertion%2A> method and can re-emit the original data as long as the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml.SamlAssertion.AssertionId%2A> property has not changed from the time that assertion was read.
It is very important that SAML assertions with different data have different IDs.
If implementing a scheme whereby an assertion "template" is loaded and certain bits of data are filled in, the Id must be changed.
The XML writer with which to write the source data.
No source data is available
Writes the SAML assertion into the specified XML writer as a `<saml:Assertion>` element.
A <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> to write the SAML assertion.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing the objects in the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion"></xref> to XML.
writer is `null`
-or-
samlSerializer is `null`
the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion"></xref> is configured such that serializing it into XML would result non-compliance with the SAML v1.1 specification.
